name: MaskedInput.Text

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component.

 * `pattern` is the pattern used to format the input value. e.g.: (###) ###-####
 * `inputCharacter`: is the special character used to represent user input. Default value: `#`
 * `toMsg`: is the Msg for updating internal `State` of the element.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
aliases.type: { pattern : String , inputCharacter : Char , onInput : String -> msg , toMsg : MaskedInput.Text.State -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) }

types.name: State
types.comment: Opaque type for storing local State

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
Default value for `Options`.
 * `onInput` (type: `String -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger
 * `toMsg` (type: `String -> msg`) : The Msg for updating internal `State` of the element.

Value:

    { pattern = ""
    , inputCharacter = '#'
    , onInput = onInput
    , toMsg = toMsg
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    }

values.name: input
values.comment:
Text input element

Example:

    type Msg = InputUpdated String | StateUpdated MaskedInput.State | FocusUpdated Bool

    MaskedInput.Text.input
        { pattern = "(###) ###-####"
        , inputCharacter = '#'
        , onInput = InputUpdated
        , toMsg = StateUpdated
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "masked-input"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentState
        model.currentValue
values.type: MaskedInput.Text.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> MaskedInput.Text.State -> String -> Html.Html msg

name: MaskedInput.Number

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component.

 * `pattern` is the pattern used to format the input value. e.g.: (###) ###-####
 * `inputCharacter`: is the special character used to represent user input. Default value: `#`
 * `toMsg`: is the Msg for updating internal `State` of the element.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
aliases.type: { pattern : String , inputCharacter : Char , onInput : Maybe.Maybe Int -> msg , toMsg : MaskedInput.Number.State -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) }

types.name: State
types.comment: Opaque type for storing local State

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
Default value for `Options`.
 * `onInput` (type: `Maybe Int -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger
 * `toMsg` (type: `String -> msg`) : The Msg for updating internal `State` of the element.

Value:

    { pattern = ""
    , inputCharacter = '#'
    , onInput = onInput
    , toMsg = toMsg
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    }

values.name: input
values.comment:
Masked Number input element

Example:

    type Msg = InputUpdated (Maybe Int) | StateUpdated MaskedInput.State | FocusUpdated Bool

    MaskedInput.Number.input
        { pattern = "(###) ###-####"
        , inputCharacter = '#'
        , onInput = InputUpdated
        , toMsg = StateUpdated
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "masked-input"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentState
        model.currentValue
values.type: MaskedInput.Number.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> MaskedInput.Number.State -> Maybe.Maybe Int -> Html.Html msg

name: Input.Text

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component.

 * `maxLength` is the maximum number of character allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
 * `type_` is the type of the HTML input element.
aliases.type: { maxLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , onInput : String -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) , type_ : String }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
Default value for `Options`.
 * `onInput` (type: `String -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger

Value:

    { maxLength = Nothing
    , onInput = onInput
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    , type_ = "text"
    }

values.name: input
values.comment:
Text input element

Example:

    type Msg = InputUpdated String | FocusUpdated Bool

    Input.Text.input
        { maxLength = 10
        , onInput = InputUpdated
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "textInput"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentValue
values.type: Input.Text.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> String -> Html.Html msg

name: Input.Number

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component.

 * `maxLength` is the maximum number of character allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `maxValue` is the maximum number value allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `minValue` is the minimum number value allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
aliases.type: { maxLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , maxValue : Maybe.Maybe Int , minValue : Maybe.Maybe Int , onInput : Maybe.Maybe Int -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) }

aliases.name: StringOptions
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component with `String` value.

 * `maxLength` is the maximum number of character allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `maxValue` is the maximum number value allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `minValue` is the minimum number value allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
aliases.type: { maxLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , maxValue : Maybe.Maybe Int , minValue : Maybe.Maybe Int , onInput : String -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
Default value for `Options`.
Params:
 * `onInput` (type: `Maybe Int -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger

Value:

    { onInput = onInput
    , maxLength = Nothing
    , maxValue = Nothing
    , minValue = Nothing
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    }

values.name: defaultStringOptions
values.comment:
Default options for input with `String` value
Params:
 * `onInput` (type: `String -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger

Value:

    { onInput = onInput
    , maxLength = Nothing
    , maxValue = Nothing
    , minValue = Nothing
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    }

values.name: input
values.comment:
View function

Example:

    type alias Model = { currentValue : Maybe Int }

    type Msg = InputUpdated (Maybe Int) | FocusUpdated Bool

    Input.Number.input
        { onInput = InputUpdated
        , maxLength = Nothing
        , maxValue = 1000
        , minValue = 10
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "numberInput"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentValue
values.type: Input.Number.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Maybe.Maybe Int -> Html.Html msg

values.name: inputString
values.comment:
View function for input with `String` value

Example:

    type alias Model = { currentValue : String }

    type Msg = InputUpdated String | FocusUpdated Bool

    Input.Number.inputString
        { onInput = InputUpdated
        , maxLength = Nothing
        , maxValue = 1000
        , minValue = 10
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "numberInput"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentValue
values.type: Input.Number.StringOptions msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> String -> Html.Html msg

name: Input.BigNumber
comment:
Big Number input.
This is a number input for big number values that can't be stored using `Int` and uses `String` instead.

# View
@docs input, Options, defaultOptions

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options of the input component.

 * `maxLength` is the maximum number of character allowed in this input. Set to `Nothing` for no limit.
 * `onInput` is the Msg tagger for the onInput event.
 * `hasFocus` is an optional Msg tagger for onFocus/onBlur event.
aliases.type: { maxLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , onInput : String -> msg , hasFocus : Maybe.Maybe (Bool -> msg) }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
Default value for `Options`.
Params:
 * `onInput` (type: `String -> msg`) : The onInput Msg tagger

Value:

    { onInput = onInput
    , maxLength = Nothing
    , hasFocus = Nothing
    }

values.name: input
values.comment:
View function

Example:

    type Msg = InputUpdated String | FocusUpdated Bool

    Input.Number.input
        { onInput = InputUpdated
        , maxLength = Nothing
        , maxValue = 1000
        , minValue = 10
        , hasFocus = Just FocusUpdated
        }
        [ class "numberInput"
        ...
        ]
        model.currentValue
values.type: Input.BigNumber.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> String -> Html.Html msg

name: MultiSelect
comment:
MultiSelect

`<select>` element with multiple selection.
This will properly give you the selected values for `onChange` event since the core `onChange` on `select` doesn't.

Options
@docs Item, Options, defaultOptions

# View
@docs multiSelect

aliases.name: Item
aliases.comment:
Item is the individual content of the dropdown.

 * `value` is the item value or `id`
 * `text` is the display text of the multi-select item.
 * `enabled` is a flag to indicate whether the item is enabled or disabled.
aliases.type: { value : String, text : String, enabled : Bool }

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options for the dropdown.

 * `items` is content of the dropdown.
 * `onChange` is the message for when the selected value in the multi-select is changed.
aliases.type: { items : List MultiSelect.Item, onChange : List String -> msg }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Default Options, will give you empty multi-select with no empty item

values.name: multiSelect
values.comment:
Html element.

Put this in your view's Html content.
Example:

    type Msg = MultiSelectChanged (List String)

    Html.div []
        [ multiSelect
            (defaultOptions MultiSelectChanged)
            [ class "my-multiSelect" ]
            model.selectedValues
        ]
values.type: MultiSelect.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List String -> Html.Html msg

name: Dropdown

aliases.name: Item
aliases.comment:
Item is the individual content of the dropdown.

 * `value` is the item value or `id`
 * `text` is the display text of the dropdown item.
 * `enabled` is a flag to indicate whether the item is enabled or disabled.
aliases.type: { value : String, text : String, enabled : Bool }

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Options for the dropdown.

 * `items` is content of the dropdown.
 * `emptyItem` is the item for when the nothing is selected. Set to `Nothing` for no empty item.
 * `onChange` is the message for when the selected value in the dropdown is changed.
aliases.type: { items : List Dropdown.Item , emptyItem : Maybe.Maybe Dropdown.Item , onChange : Maybe.Maybe String -> msg }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Default Options, will give you empty dropdown with no empty item

values.name: dropdown
values.comment:
Html element.

Put this in your view's Html content.
Example:

    type Msg = DropdownChanged String

    Html.div []
        [ Dropdown.dropdown
            (Dropdown.defaultOptions DropdownChanged)
            [ class "my-dropdown" ]
            model.selectedDropdownValue
        ]
values.type: Dropdown.Options msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Maybe.Maybe String -> Html.Html msg
